2. Place 2 - Jeff Harris

Place 2 - Jeff Harris
=====================

**May 2023-25**

Jeff Harris was born and raised in Victoria, TX, until joining the United States Marine Corps. in 1992.
Jeff has been married to his best friend, Kristy, for 13 years. Kristy is a retired Detective with the Kerrville Police Department and is now the LMSW at Peterson Health. Jeff moved from Georgetown to Kerrville as a Golf Professional at Riverhill Country Club in 2005. In 2017, Jeff started work with Community First National Bank as a mortgage loan originator, and in January 2022, he was moved to Senior Vice President of Lending and Branch Executive of SouthStar Bank- Kerrville after the acquisition in September of 2021.
City Council Place 2 – Current
Member of Kerrville E.I.C. – Current Council Appointment
President, Hill Country Crisis Council – 2021 – Present
Director with Together with Hill Country Veterans – Current
Member of the Veterans Service Advisory Council – Kerr County – Current
Co-chair for the Veterans Breakfast held 2x a year at The Hill Country Veterans Center
Director with The Hill Country Gala – Current
Kerr County First Responders Foundation Member, Rotary Club of Kerrville
Ordained Deacon in The Presbyterian Church
Former Assistant TX State Director – Veterans Golfers Association of America
Former President of The Ingram Police Benevolent Foundation
Former Commissioner on Kerrville Planning and Zoning 2022-2023
Leadership Kerr County – Class 36
In his personal life, Jeff enjoys cooking, playing golf, spending time with Kristy, and traveling when they have the opportunity, and his newest endeavor is learning the tenor saxophone.
He balances his professional career, personal life, community service commitment to his dedicated boards, and dedication to the City of Kerrville as your elected City Council Member Place 2.
